Not quite the Bioshock everyone was expecting right? Where's the Little Sisters? Where's the Big Daddies? The Plasmids? Why isn't it Rapture!?!? I myself and plenty of my friends have sat here and said "If its not Rapture its not Bioshock!" however unlike some of them I actually still wanted to check out what Infinite was all about where others refuse to play this title simply cause of the location. Despite this personal reason so to speak I love Bioshock Infinite and there's no reason to rule it out due to it's alternate location! It's certainly a game to consider playing whether your a newcomer to the franchise or a fan from the Original Bioshock games set in Rapture. Its not Rapture but that doesn't mean its not a fantastic game like the previous Bioshocks!

With that said this game isn't set in the Underwater city as we know Rapture. Nope, Infinite is set in the airborne city known as Columbia. The year is 1912 and you are playing a character called Booker Dewitt. You are tasked with a mission to retrieve a girl called Elizabeth and bring her back to the Luteces to repay a debt. Things get a little more complicated than that however and evolves in your Journey with Elizabeth to stop her Guardian known as "Songbird" and alongside that to confronting her father and learning more about herself.

So whats so special about Elizabeth? This girl has a gift so to speak where she's able to create these "Tears" in reality to a different universe. Sounds somewhat confusing no? It will be explained however it is also a helpful maneuver in your gameplay! While this mission is seeming to be an escort mission she is never a burden unlike some I can think of.. "Leon!" Heh, she doesn't get in your way and never seems like a burden at any point, far from it. She will toss you money, discover and throw you ammo,salts (Vigor/Mana Resource) or even health packs during combat! Not only this but you can exploit her tear ability to bring in supplies or even things such as turrets to aid you too! Certainly a helpful gal. The enemies never directly attack her so in result it doesnt feel like she's a huge liability. It doesnt feel like an Escort mission throughout the entire game and most will be relieved to hear that.

So with the story set in motion what is Columbia? Columbia is a fantastic floating/airborne City that is simply stunning! Fantastic detail to the atmosphere and beautiful sight to behold. The whole 'old' essence about it all given this is set in 1912 is emphasized brilliantly! So Columbia seems like a great place to be right? Well thats the image I thought of at first however it turns out that Columbia is a.. Well to put bluntly a White-man City. It turns out that this seeming peaceful city is actually full of racsists so to speak. Quite an eye opener when first realising it! You'll see... On further information about Columbia, its citizens turn to a certain person known as "The Prophet" as he fortells the future of Columbia and able to predict the actions of this "False Shepard" in which he labels as Booker Dewitt. The False Shepard character is used as a individual to Corrupt the "Lamb of Columbia". This shall be explained in game!

Quite a story set in motion! But how does it play? Gameplay is great, just like the other Bioshocks. In this game you are able to carry two main weapons. Sadly there isn't any weapon purchase stations unlike the first games which does limit you to find two weapons you like or simply the best to make the experience easier and stick with them the whole game. Its a shame there isnt more of a variety of what you could do to make it so you could utilize the other weapons more appropriately. I only found myself using the Shotgun and the Volley gun. On the odd occassion if the distance was long enough and there was a Sniper "Tear" at my disposal I would temporarily swap out my Shotgun for the sniper and dispose of my enemies before swapping them back. Just a point Id like to add where some it might not bother but certainly did me a touch.
In this game Plasmids are now called "Vigors". Its the same crack from the previous games. Some sort of magic ability if you will where you can throw firebombs or throw a flock of flesh eating crows at your enemies, using your environment to your advantage by throwing a firebomb on a fuel puddle or lightning bolts at a.. well water puddle to define the difference between the two! Also to note your Sky-Hook is a fantastic melee weapon! And a rather bloody one too as you'll with your first encounter... Quite something I wasn't expecting that much I'l say! Besides it being an deadly weapon it's also a tool to help you get around on Columbia's "Skyline". Think like a roller coaster but without seatbelts! Certainly a great and interesting way to get around some areas and as well around your enemies but even on that note your enemies will even join  you on the Skyline and follow you! That is a great mechanic!

So after all that you may be asking yourself, is there a twist? As for those who have played the previous Bioshock games know that there is a twist in both of the previous games and you may questioned yourselves, Is it the same deal? And thy answer to said question is Yes! There is a twist, one that even Im still trying to pull together after finishing the game! The twist lingers and makes you wonder and its great that a game can do that!  

So in Conclusion I would like to state that Bioshock Infinite is simply a fantastic, stunning and a pleasure to play! As a fan of the Rapture Bioshock games I had my doubts, I will be honest but now I cant believe that I let it be a reason to stop me from playing this game and in result I'm glad I decided to pick this up after reading much about it while also witnessing that this game getting much attention for one of the most anticipated games of 2013! My rating is 9/10! I will certainly be coming back to this game just to nab those additional achievements and complete on higher difficulties while enjoying the atmosphere of the world of Columbia! There is also Dlc being made "Burial At Sea" which I will certainly get round to picking up at some point to enjoy this game even further!

So is one of the most anticipated games of 2013 worth the money? Really want to ask that question? I think we both know that answer...
Sehr gut, nur leider ist die Spielzeit insgesamt ein wenig kurz ansonsten 1+

The only qualm I may have is the ending, I liked the ending and it felt right for the overall story, but it left me wanting more. It felt unfinished but that is sort of the point so I can't fault it on that. A month later and I am still thiunking about the game BUY IT!

Just yes. Just awesome. Im gonna miss it a lot. I love it for being epic. I hate it for being short. There is not many such good games. Now i have mixed feelings abt it. Still. it was awesome experience. I want it to last longer. Dont even want to play worse games. Its always like that. After finishing a great game, reading an awesome book, watching an epic movie. You just dont want to play, read or watch anything worse. he problem is finding something better or as good as it was is hard. Unique games dont have similar twins. Great games have to end. Unfortunately, nothing lasts forever. Otherwise, it would become boring. I am happy of being able to play it.

Tercera entrega de la saga Bioshock que se ambienta en el año 1912 y presenta una experiencia narrativa totalmente nueva que saca a los jugadores del entorno familiar de Rapture, y les lanza a Columbia, una inmensa y vertiginosa ciudad en el cielo.

Ken Levine tiene nuevo juego, lo que significa también que nosotros tenemos nueva joya que disfrutar. Bioshock vuela hasta los cielos con Infinite, y nos ofrece con ese pretexto uno de los mejores shooters de los últimos tiempos. Asombrosa historia, muy buenas mecánicas shooter, y una Elizabeth que se convertirá en piedra angular de lo que se nos cuenta son sus claves. Puede que Infinite no asombre tanto como la primera parte de la serie, pero es un juego maravilloso y absolutamente 

Nota personal: 8,5

Pros: 
1) A very well-polished FPS
2) interesting combat system
3) love the skyline! 
4) It's hard not to fall in love in Elizabeth

Cons:
1) limited only 2 weapons can be equipped at a time is a big letdown for me
2) when shield is recovering, the yellowish "cracking" effect on the edges of the screen can sometimes obscure view
3) sometimes "tearing" / "time-traveling" / sudden shifting of scenes confused me on the story

Overall verdict: 8.5/10

ถ้าพูดถึงเรื่องกราฟฟิค ใน Bioshock ภาคนี้ยกระดับขึ้นมาจากภาคก่อนๆหน้าได้เยอะทีเดียว ทั้งเรื่อง Dim Light และ Motion Blur ดูพริ้วมากขึ้น รวมไปถึงระบบเกมและเนื้อเรื่องที่ดูแปลกไปหน่อย แต่ถูกใจเกมเมอร์แน่นอน ^^

Bioshock Infinite is a great game. It has one of the best stories ever seen in a game. However, the story is obscured by the gunplay. There is too much of it. It isn't Call of Duty. You basically shoot up the place and then there is some story as a reward. Amazing visuals and animation. After a second play through, the original amazing game that you once saw Bioshock Infinite as, disappears and you begin to see the flaws in the game.
What hasn't been said about this game that I can add? It's good.
This game is beautiful, I can't say much from the story line because I haven't played any other bioshocks, but so far it's gorgeous
AMAZING GAME. BUY IF YOU LOVE GAMES

This a great game. The story is good. The gameplay is fun, but one major flaw I already found in this game is the fact thay they removed manual saves, but instead uses auto saves and trust me, these aren't constant auto saves.

Absolutely incredible, in every sense of the word. Masterfully crafted, from its story, to its aesethics, to its themes and motifs that go well beyond anything that you've seen before in a game, or any other visual medium for that matter.

Whilst the gameplay tends to be on the easy side, and is nothing groundbreaking in itself, it is still a very gratifying experience. The ludicrous amount of detail found in every nook and cranny in Columbia makes it very easy to lose yourself in the story and its many nuances, and makes the game very, very difficult to put down at any point.

Bioshock: Infinite can be described as nothing short of a tour-de-force.
It is probably still good
Very NICE!!!
My mind is blown.

What a journey. Absolutely engrossing character development between the two leads, with brilliant voice acting and a story that really pulls you in. The floating city is beautiful and fun to explore, and the other characters, groups, enemies etc are all really well done.

I'm not a big fan of the 'pick two guns at any one time' combat philosophy (as you only ever take the guns you feel most comfortable so never really explore all weaponry, alternative modes etc), and you never earn enough money to upgrade all powers and weapons. To be honest, the combat of the game was a bit 'meh' for me because of this, but the story was gripping enough to keep me playing, and I don't regret it!

Overall I finished the game with that feeling you get when you finish a really engorssing book and you instanlty miss the main characters. Thankfully I've got the DLC to play now!

P.S. Make sure you watch the credits to the end to catch a beautiful video of a duet between the two lead voice actors.
It's Awesome
I LOVE THIS GAME !!

An immersive, exciting and all around fun first person shooter. The guns are satisfying to shoot and all of them feel useful. The Vigors are awesome to use in combat and have enough variety to provide interesting combinations and strategies in combat. The graphics are absolutly gorgeous and are stunning to look at. Every little area is filled to the brim with things to find and incredible attention to detail. Believe me, I spent way longer than I should have just walking around Columbia during the opening. The Skyhook is an interesting mechanic, and flying along the rollercoaster-like rails is very fun and provides you with tons of mobility. The Handymen give that same feeling of panic and fear that Big Daddies did in the original bioshock, and everytime you encounter on is a thrill. Last but not least, Elizabeth is an incredible companion. She saved me many times, and having her there makes you feel like you are always in the fight. Plus her tears provide a whole new level of depth to combat. This game is one of the best I've ever played, I extremely recomend it. It's one of the few FPS games that feels like an experience rather than just a game (You could say the fun is INFINITE! huehuehuehuehue). Bioshock Infinite gets a 10/10 in my book!
This game is so beautiful, the fighting sytem is great and overall the gameplay is fantastic, I definitly recommend the game to anyone that wants a good story

To be honest i haven’t completed the game and don’t see myself finishing it any time soon, this isn’t a film i expect a game to rely on more than just its story which unfortunately  BioShock Infinite seems to have forgotten. I dont think Bioshock is a bad game but its strictly mediocre at best. Heres some of the issues:

-You can only carry two guns at once and ammo is so rare that you will be forced to carry the crappy guns that all the enemies carry.
-Upgrades cost way to much so it’s unlikely that you'll be able to afford many of them.
-The guns feel awful they carry no weight to them and you don’t get any enjoyment out of using them.
-Plasmids are in the game for no apparent reason (and aren’t explained at all stunning plot) and what’s worse they are all EXACTLY THE SAME you can fire them at enemies or set a trap on the floor.....that is all.
-You'll spend around 80% of your time in combat and it never changes due to lack of enemy variety and the point mentioned earlier about lack of ammo causing you to use same shitty guns. 
-Enemy AI is awful all the enemies are bullet sponges and charge your position.
-Melee combat tagged on and adds nothing to gameplay
-Handymen...
-Tooltips in the middle of combat
-No way to avoid or use stealth completely linear experience.
-No strategic aspect like the Big Daddys out of Bioshock 1 and 2, in fact in comparison to Bioshock 1 it feels dumbed down in general plot included.

All in all it seems that way to much time was spent building the world of Bioshock infinite and gameplay was rushed in, in the last couple of months and that said the story is hardly mindblowing either the game jumps between a dozens of different themes and so far hasn’t fleshed out any of them.
THIS GAME GOOD YES. MANY ENJOY!

My favourite part about the game is the story line . Most games now days just follow along the same boring storys but this has a completley different story and makes you think
Definitley recommend
Best story to any game I've ever played; truly magnificent.

Beautiful graphics, echanting story, I absolutely loved this game and will definitely play through it again to find all the things I missed. Beautiful graphics, enchanting story
Best game I've played so far. It has a really good storyline. And the combat is cool.

BioShock Infinite – это игра шедевр, игра произведение искусства, игра, которую просто невозможно сразу переварить.

Первое что въедается в память с первых же минут – потрясающая древесина в лодке и ручейки дождя, стекающие по белым стенам маяка и капли танцующие джангу под ногами, а камни, мокрым камням нужно вручить приз за самый лучший мокрый вид! Точнее тем, кто их сотворил. Второе - все остальное, от рассвета, до заката, от начала и до конца. Крючок вонзается слишком глубоко, чтобы можно было соскочить.

Попав в Колумбию, у меня отвисла челюсть, ну может не буквально, но после слов “аллилуйя”, дыхание перехватило и я почувствовал… ВОСТОРГ, да – это подходящее слово для тех эмоций, которые зародились и поднялись из глубины души, материализовавшись в тривиальные звуковые вибрации, печатать которые, по некоторым соображениям, я не стану. Чтобы запечатлеть все путешествие, потребовался ни один терабайт несжатого видео.

Но конечно в первую очередь, игра хороша не своей графикой или геймплеем, а сюжетом! О котором я не скажу ни слова, чтобы не испортить рандомному читателю аппетит, а то и вовсе впечатление о блюде. Упомяну лишь, что лично у меня сей продукт вызвал: боль, тоску, отчаяние и… вакуум, который смог лишь частично заполнить обыкновенный сон. 

Вопросов было слишком много. Как оказалось, эта игра не игривое вино, а самый настоящий неразбавленный абсент, злоупотребление которым с разной долей вероятности приводит к душевным расстройствам и навязчивым идеям. К сожалению, лечащего врача не оказалось рядом и я прошел игру повторно в режиме “1999 год”, чем только усугубил BioShock Infinite головного мозга. В качестве полумеры, я принялся за Clash in the Clouds, осилив и его, я впился, как голодная пиявка в сочного купальщика, в лице Burial at sea ep. One. В завершении, я могу сказать лишь три вещи:

I)	Нет, я боюсь тебя.
II)	Мне действительно жаль!
III)	Я ХОЧУ ЕЩЕ!!!! Но пора уже возвращаться в палату.
best ending ever

Great graphics, intresting characters, fun for one play through but I feel no motivation in replaying it. There should of been some RPG elements, the story just diden't draw me in like it seem to have for many people honestly im not sure what people see in these bioshock games. The vigors are almost useless and annoying to use, the only real fun part was shooting enemies heads off with the sniper rifle lol. With the unreal engine its of course a great & fluid FPS but compared to games like Far Cry 3, Dishonored, or Metro LL overall this game feels like a childs game. Its a good game if you want to show off your hardware if not I would wait till it goes on sale.

The whole thing is eye candy, but the candy store is closed.  Like it's predecessors, it offers the potential for an open world that would be wonderful to explore, yet you're never given a chance.  It offers a dark, mysterious and compelling narrative unfortunately bogged down by cumbersome gameplay, plodding and repetitive combat sequences, and limited weapon/armor/upgrade options that even cloud-spanning ziplines barely improve .  To be fair, the AI in combat was challenging.  But every time I came to yet another vending machine, I wanted to scream because the machines always sold the same half-dozen items.  Likewise, the entire town was populated by the same half-dozen faces saying the same half-dozen things.  This could have been a perfect game for weapon/armor crafting a la Dead Space 3 (if you want total control in developing your character into a visceral bad-ass while still retaining your humanity, play Dead Space 3) and the open-worldliness of Fallout 3.  As it is, however, I never felt compelled to continue playing in the hopes of getting to further explore the world or of stumbling upon yet another fight sequence, but only to push the narrative forward.  It might as well have been a rail shooter.  The storytelling and development of the two main characters is by far the best part of the game; everything else just gets in the way.  I'd recommend this game if you can get it on sale for less than $20.
Bom demais!!!!
A game filled with so much racial insensitivity that I literally could not stop laughing. Best comedy game of the year 2016.

As a shooter it is decent run-of-the-mill for the genre.  As an experience, it is incredible!  It is one of the only games that I have played in which I explored every nook and cranny to find all of the flavor details, and was never disappointed for my efforts.  The game keeps a great "WTF?!" feeling throughout.  The story is a bit confusing.  I had to go watch a couple of youtube videos to figure it all out, but it was satisfying none-the-less.  100% recommended.

I really wanted to like this game, and I had high hopes for it. It had been sitting in my collection for awhile, unfinished, so I decided I needed to wrap up what so many were calling the game of the year.

Unfortunately, as the game wore on it went from a fascinating adventure in an interesting setting to a fairly medicore and grindy shooter, and I found myself having little interest in who or what I was fighting, only that I had to shoot them all dead to get to the next part of the narrative. Even if I'd found the story compelling, which I didn't, the gameplay felt terribly out of place, even dated.

As more and more of the story was revealed to me, in between bouts of increasingly meaningless and tedious combat, I grew less and less eager for the big finale, since it was starting to feel so overwrought and melodramatic that I just wanted to be done with it all.

Sure enough, the preposterous ending was just as unsatisfying and drenched in false profundity as I expected.

I really think there was a solid core and a good idea for a game set in Columbia, once upon a time, but it was all too muddled and lost by the time we finally saw it.
Play this game. Tight gameplay, a thriving story, and an ending that will have you comparing others to its own value.

I've had quite a gripe for saying that 2013 was possibly the worst year for game releases in the past decade and the amount of low quality garbage that has came out this year only supports that claim, however perhaps if I discovered this game a little earlier, I would never of said it in the first place.

Infinite looks stunning- it's possibly the most visually enticing game I've seen in my lifetime. The character models, the landscape surroundings, the weapons and the lighting effects are all individually gobsmackingly brilliant on the ultra preset, or any preset for that matter.

The storyline is confusing, especially the ending, however after a bit of research it does actually make sense and it is very interesting and rich. I won't spoil it for obvious reasons and the fact that the game is centred all around making you wonder just what the hell is going on, but if you decide to play through the game and end up getting confused, have no fear- you're not the only one.

"Finally, a game for smart gamers" stated employed critics- "Absolute jargon" is my response. Despite the storyline being very complex, there is no way in hell that anyone could say that this game requires you to have an IQ of 1337 to complete as it's not that challenging nor is their any truly difficult puzzles to conquer, in fact, I'd say it was quite linear in terms of its actual gameplay.

Overall, a very impressive, yet somewhat short experience considering what I paid, would highly recommend when on sale.
Super, hat Spaß gemacht!

This game is just awesome. And by saying awesome I mean SIMPLY INCREDIBLY AWESOME. This is masterpiece, 11/10, this game has best plot ever created. This is far better than plot of 99% movies, this actually IS a movie, a book, more than just a game. If you like strong plot, if you like steampunk, if you like Bioshock you will definitely like this.
Eine witzige Mischung zwischen EGO-Shooter und RPG. Ich mag es sehr gerne spielen und die Story ist wirklich gut.
11/10 would need to finish

Se você jogou Bioshock 1 ou 2 vai gostar deste também.
Tá vendo o trailer do jogo??? Viu??? E ficou de boca aberta?? Então pode ficar tranquilo que tudo aquilo que você viu no trailer do jogo você literalmente vai jogar.
E a história nem se fala. Excelente jogo para quem gosta de jogos de ação.
Enredo, gráfico, músicas, personagens são muitos bons.
Literalmente recomendo para quem já jogou os primeiro Bioshocks.

The combat isn't acctually that bad; true some of the enemys can get a little bullet spongy, but the few weapons feel great to shoot, the gear you wear acctually makes a big difference to the style of fighting, and the satisfaction of a headshot in this game can't be overlooked. The world is definitely the best part of the game however, with incredible level design. Not as much in terms of arena style battles, but in terms of the enjoyment the game manages to create when exploring the world, which is beyond comparison. The quality of the story goes without saying, and in all honesty this 10 times the experience you would get from a movie. "11/10 ign".

At first I wasn't sure if I thought this installment was going to live up to it's counterparts, but it does and has quickly become my favorite game within the Bioshock series. I immediately started playing the game all over again after beating originally, just to take as much of the game in as I possibly could.
WHAT A GAME!
Awesome Game with a real nice atmosphere and story. I like the controls better than BioShock one, and really had to adjust to them after playing this game.
best game ever

Bioshock Infinite ist mit 20 Spielstunden realtiv kurz. Ich bin nicht durchgerennt, sondern habe nebenbei noch viele Extras eingesammelt.
Trotzdem hat mich das Spiel gefesselt wie schon lange kein Spiel mehr. Wunderschöne Grafik und noch schönere Effekte im Spiel. Die Story ist unglaublich gut und man ist ständig am Überlegen, was als nächstes kommen könnte.
Elizabeth überzeugt zu 100% in ihrer Rolle.
Das Spiel hat seine 91 Metascorepunkte vollkommen zu Recht.

Best game I've played since Half-Life 2. The gameplay may not be very special, but the story and presentation are amazing. The story really gripped me and kept me on the edge of my seat until the very last second. No lame ending as so many games have nowadays, but one that is deeply satisfying. The visuals are gorgeous with very lush colors. If you're thinking of upgrading your PC, do so before playing this game. :)
It's one of my favorite games of 2013 the action is packed...and the guns are blazing elizabeth is the very helpful in times of need,one of the best AI characters ive seen in awhile.
Uma das melhores historias que eu ja vi em um game, personagens carismaticos principalmente Elizabeth
Zwar nur kurze Spieldauer,aber richtig gutes Spiel

Bioshock Infinite es el broche perfecto a la experiencia shooter que ya nos ofreció el maestro Ken Levine con su Bioshock original. Una historia que a priori parece no estar relacionada en absoluto con ese primer juego pero que poco a poco nos va sorprendiendo con un entramado rara vez visto en un videojuego de estas características.
La sensación que me quedó después de terminar Bioshock Infinite fue similar a cuando fui al cine a ver una buena película de Christopher Nolan; has sido testigo de un gran espectáculo sí, pero es cuando ya ha pasado algún tiempo y sigues dándole vueltas a esa historia, cuando descubres que no te han contado una historia más sino algo muy especial y personal.
Recomendación del Mandril.
Richtig Hammer Geiles Spiel! :333
Leuk dat het spel elke keer vast loopt.
Bischock Infinite =Geil !!!

[u][b]A trip to Infinity[/b][/u]

After playing the previous BioShock games, I really wanted to play BioShock Infinite.
The game drops you in an unbelievable world, the city of Columbia. This setting amazingly decorated in American glory, with a steampunk allure. Best part, the whole city is floating in the air.

[b]Bring us the girl, and wipe away the debt[/b] 

The game follows veteran Booker DeWitt on his journey to rescue a mysterious girl named Elizabeth. Booker is followed by his past, and all he wants is to begin anew. As you travel trough Columbia, you wil soon discover the dark parts of this new Eden. The story is very well written, and will bring up lots of discussion.

[b]sky-high combat[/b]

BioShock Infinite gives the player various options for its combat. Armed with both strong weapons and powerful vigors (comparable to plasmids) the player can wield deadly combinations, both for close combat or the long range. This gives the player more freedom, compared to the previous BioShock games, which focused more on close combat. In the process, sky-lines add an extra dimension. Also, the powers that Elizabeth wields work very well with the flow of the combat.

To me, this game is truly Game of the Year 2013, and really worth playing
Perfect balance between story, graphics and gameplay!

This is a beautiful game with a pretty good story. Game play is really good. You have some pretty cool superpowers. The ending does get confusing though. Prepare to go to youtube for ending explanations.

En solde a 7.5 euros, super affaire. Juste génial, basé en grande partie sur une personnage IA(la fille) qui ne bugue pas souvent et est plus attachante que le héro. Graphismes bons et renouvelle le genre depuis Rapture, fin refléchie par les concepteurs/à réfléchir par le joueur.
Это Шедевр!!

Really nice-looking game, great gameplay, and a storytelling where your decisions make the difference of the outcome! Highly recommended!

Rating: 8/10

This game is now 2nd on my all-time favourites list. There is no way in hell any one can write a better game story like this. The ego, values, and belief’s this game challenge’s is what makes it so fun to play.. The twist at the end of the game and the follow ups on the dlc was worth it…

Hope some other game developers can learn from these people …. I would love to see the next bioshock and tell you now I will pre order if they make new games

Even after seeing so much about this online and all the "spoilers", the storyline was definitely the best of a shooter I've ever played and the ending still kinda blew my mind a bit. I mean, Bioshock was great gameplay and I can't say it's too different, but the story of Infinite blows it out of the water. A+
easily my favorite bioshock yet!

Es un juegazo, aparte de la historia, lo que mas me gusto fue la musica, los sonidos ambientales, y obviamente elizabeth. Lo recomiendo 100% aunque en la dificultad "normal" es un poco facil, pero lo demas exelente.
one of the best games of 2013, worth buying and enjoying ;)

Ураганный шутер. Весьма необычный геймплей. До мелочей продуманный сюжет. Приятная графика. Потрясающий саундтрек. Превосходный дизайн локаций. Это и многое другое...
Но главные слова характеризующие игру: утопия, тлен, бесконечность. 
Тут больше нечего говорить - запускай и играй!
10/10.

PROS:  Great storyline, game mechanics are fun and interesting, the soundtrack is amazing.

CONS: The best part of the game, the skylines, are disappointing: you only get to use them a couple times and they're really short. The game tries to be immersive but the AI is bad, collecting items is tiresome, and a lot of things about this game are repetitive to the point of being boring sometimes. They're trying to be a AAA game but the world feels really empty. This is not worth 50$, glad I got it on special or I'd feel ripped off.
Short, but very good story.

Don't consider this game as a Shock series game. Consider this game as a normal FPS instead of a RPG. And sadly the FPS part of this game is medicore and functional at best. Ultimately the game is filled with repetitive shooting for 10 hours before players get to the last 20 minutes of non-interactive ending, which does not reward the players in any ways what-so-ever. It is sad that a game with a wonderful soundtrack and fantastic visuals falls short when the gameplay is not entertaining in any particular ways.
I'm pretty sure this is the first game I've sat down and played all the way through, in one sitting, if not the first and only, then it's at least the first in a couple of years.

A really awesome game!

Gameplay similar to Bioshock, but story and setting is even better in my opinion.

Finishing the game is like finishing a really great TV series. You can't play anything else till it's sunk in. Even then, all you want to do is play it again

10 / 10 for me
Adictivo!
is good
One of the best storytelling experienced i have ever had in a video game. Highly recomended and would buy this again anyday.
